JobFullDesc: ABOUT THE ROLEAs a Strategic Partnerships Lead, you will be responsible for pursuing retail partnerships for our delivery API solution. Uber Direct allows brands to offer same day delivery to their customers on their websites or apps using Uber’s fleet. You will be responsible for partnering with the Sales Ops, Legal and Product teams to build relationships with enterprise partners in the grocery, alcohol, convenience and pharmacy space. We are looking for someone with experience selling and negotiating enterprise contracts for technical products.WHAT YOU'LL DOLead end to end sales motion for Enterprise Direct prospects including qualification, education, pricing/quoting, contract negotiation to close dealsPartner closely with cross-functional teams on each account to collaboratively position and sell Direct to brands in New VerticalsBuild strategic relationships to gain positioning with decision makers while driving growth of new Direct businessThink strategically about how Direct could uniquely fit into each brand’s delivery offering and within the larger Uber relationshipShare merchant insights with business & product teams to drive continuous improvements in the Direct offeringHelp identify and build best practices for our sales team and Uber EatsProvide opportunity status by regularly updating SFDC, doing forecasts and participating in quarterly business reviews BASIC QUALIFICATIONSMinimum of 3 years of full-time experience in end-to-end Enterprise sales and/or partnershipsExperience selling into or partnering with large, complex enterprise brands and organizationsExperience working cross functionallyPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSExperience with delivery or logistics at a high-growth tech companyExperience working cross collaboratively with different business teams and partnering on deals to get them across the finish lineExperience leading conversations with executive level external partnersAbility to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyersExcellent listening, communication, and organizational skillsExcellent negotiation, forecasting, and problem solving skillsCollaborative leadership. You can’t help but dig in tactically, flexing your analytical skills where needed, and are equally as comfortable leading a conversation with an Engineer, Product Manager, or C-level executive to secure buy-inCoachability, interest in implementing feedback, and dedication to the improvement of your craft and our team's developmentSpeed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter mentality. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and navigating ambiguityProficiency with SalesforceBachelor's Degree or equivalent
